intro: Limonium korbousense, commonly known as the Korbous sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils, showing a high tolerance for salt and wind. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking appearance. Limonium korbousense is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun conditions.
